article.headline: Florida A&M 66, Howard 65
article.story: TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) -- Rome Sanders' 20 points and Tony Tate's go-ahead layup with four seconds left to play powered Florida A&M to a 66-65 win over Howard Monday. The victory moved the Rattlers (10-9, 6-2) over the .500-mark for the first time since Nov.29. Following Tate's layup, the Rattlers were handed a bench technical foul. Howard (2-14, 1-6) was unable to convert on the rewarded two free throws as Louis Ford was only able to convert on one of his two attempts from the charity stripe. Darrly Hudson led Howard with 14 points while Tate assisted in the home squads victory with 12 points. Howard took a 41-36 advantage into the halftime break.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
